People who think Bernie will usher in communism are kidding themselves. He won’t even win by the margins needed to pass his agenda if he wins, and even if he did, it still wouldn’t be communism. Disagree all day, but hyperbole is not your friend.

snippet.textDisplay: Really ?    No candidate who pronounces "Iraq"  as  "Eye raq" ,  and  "Iran" as  "Eye ran"  will win the nomination.  Main reason is, it shows that if they do not want to correctly pronounce names of countries which are in the news every day, then they are ignorant, arrogant, or both.  The  "i" in those names is pronounced "e", as in the name, Ian.  "Ian" is pronounced "E un",  is it not ?  It would sound stupid if you were to call someone "i un" .  Here's more for a Saturday;  "progress" is not pronounced "prawgress".  It is "pro gress", like "pro gram", "pro test".  You wouldn't say "praw test", would you ?  It's basic English, which most people in the media do not speak well.  Those like Gale King, Anthony Mason, Norah O'Donnel and the rest at CBS, CNN, ABC, NBC, FOX,  and in Canada, CP24,  CityTv, CBC and Global.   They ALL speak incorrect basic English.   Hypocrites, that's what they are, and not to mention,  UNPROFESSIONAL.

snippet.textDisplay:
My friend pointed out:
Bernie sanders said in the SC debate that he wanted the minimum wage to be $15 per hour.
$15 X 40 hr week = $600
$600 X 52 weeks per year = $31,200
Bernie Sanders wants free health care for all and was asked how he would pay for it. His answer was to raise taxes to 52% on anybody making over $29.000 per year.
52% of $31,200 = $16,224 in tax.
$31,200 - $16,224 = $14,976 is your pay.
$14,976 / 52 weeks = $288 per week
$288 / 40 hr week = $7.20 per hour
snippet.textOriginal:
My friend pointed out:  
Bernie sanders said in the SC debate that he wanted the minimum wage to be $15 per hour.
$15 X 40 hr week = $600
$600 X 52 weeks per year = $31,200 
Bernie Sanders wants free health care for all and was asked how he would pay for it. His answer was to raise taxes to 52% on anybody making over $29.000 per year.
52% of $31,200 = $16,224 in tax.
$31,200 - $16,224 = $14,976 is your pay.
$14,976 / 52 weeks = $288 per week
$288 / 40 hr week = $7.20 per hour

snippet.textDisplay:
@BernieSanders
Hi. People keep asking about 30 trillion over 10 years. You need a better answer. Here it is:
"Yes, it will cost 30 trillion. Do you know how much we spend right now over ten years? 35 trillion. It is actually less expensive than our current health care costs" That's the answer. See the link for the data (and by the way internet, this is called ACTUAL reality, supported by facts that are REAL).


"US health spending reached $3.5 trillion in 2017, or $10,739 per capital, and accounted for 17.9% of gross
domestic product (GDP). "


https://chcf.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/HealthCareCostsAlmanac2019.pdf


3.5 trillion per year. That's how much we spend RIGHT NOW. Multiply times 10 years = 35 trillion. That's how much we are ALREADY spending. Yes 30 trillion is huge number. But 35 trillion is an even huger number! This is your answer to that question! Do the damn math people! Where is Andrew Yang when we need him? Former #YangGang here (he was the best), now #Sanders.


Unions and health care.
Here is the better answer to the question about unions and health care:
Bernie: "Does your union negotiate better/lower health care for it's members?" Guy answers: "Yes" Bernie says: "How are they able to do that?" Guy answers: "By combining their collective buying power to get a volume discount" Bernie says: "Yes, exactly. Imagine the volume discount 300 million people will get. We will get a better price and higher quality because of our collective volume buying power". Question answered.


Internet, and people. There will be no negotiation. 300 million people will say: "this is how much we will pay" and companies will say: "Ok, sign me up" The volume is simply too high to turn down. No business in their right mind will turn down 300 million customers. No business in their right mind will turn down 1 million customers. We have to get real. This is business. and it's BIG BUSINESS. Volume buying power is extraordinarily powerful. If 300 million people want to buy something, you bet your ass someone is going to sell them that product, and they're going to kiss ass and be happy doing it, because they will still make a ridiculous amount of money. Both parties win. Life goes on. We're all healthier and happier. We all have a little more money every year. This is not rocket science.


DONE.

snippet.textDisplay: The Chinese and communism did not take more people out of poverty than any government in history.  This is Bernie's major fallacy--bad thinking--and is the foundation to all of his policy proposals.   The open U.S. capitalistic involvement with China--over the last 4 decades since Carter opened the doors to all of our IP---and Walmart--i.e. U.S. buying their goods---brought the people out of poverty.  The U.S. economy did that as it included China in our economic and technological success.

snippet.textDisplay: The plan on Bernie's own website accounts for only 15.95 trillion in increased revenue over ten years. M4A is expected to cost 30-40 trillion over ten years... he has no real tangible plan to pay for it. the US generates 3.18 trillion dollars annually in tax revenue with an average tax of 23%, some how with magic I'm guessing a 4% increase is supposed to double tax revenue... please people do your research and think realistically. Either he has no plan, or he's secretly planning massive tax increases once he's elected. neither is a good option.

snippet.textDisplay: So going off the higher end, the average cost for a 4 year private school is 37,740$. There are about 15 million students in college(14.96 million public and 5.24 million private) right now in the year of 2020. (37,740)(5.24)(x10^6) that’a 2 billion$ for private alone. According to NPR.org on how the Wall Street tax would work, the tax policy center said the potential revenue would be less than a 10th of 340 billion, i.e. 3.4 billion. This doesn’t even take into consideration of what the tax would do on the back side after the taxation is put in place.

snippet.textDisplay:
Raising minimum wage to $15 is a really stupid idea. Forcing someone to have healthcare against their will is a very foolish idea. Making college education the new minimum (high school education bring the present day minimum) makes no sense. Government funding = people funding.

I thought this might come up? How about you don't even propose something without explaining where the money comes from.

How is this guy popular?

I don't see the need to offer more of my freedoms to the government. The DMV sucks, going to the post office sucks, the IRS sucks, virtually everywhere you turn to look at how the government is treating us it's with more lines and higher fines. Bernie wants us standing in lines for bread, for medical treatment, for air if he could. Does no one else like having a choice on which insurance they use, which grocery store they go to, which brands to buy? Why did so many pay the ultimate price for freedom? Just so that it could be voted into the hands of selfish greedy tyrants like Bernie Slanders?

I will stand against socialism. I will stand against communism. I will stand against fascism. I will stand for liberty and freedom!
